An array of recipe objects for the category

instructions.description: The cooking instructions for the recipe

description.description: A brief description of the recipe

thumb.description: URL of the recipe thumbnail image

preview.description: URL of the recipe preview image

time.description: Total cooking time for the recipe

likes.description: An array of user IDs who have liked the recipe

post.summary: Adding a recipe created by the User

area.description: Geographic area where the recipe originated.

unit.description: Unit of measurement for the ingredient.

ingredients.description: List of ingredients required for the recipe.

instructions.description: Step-by-step instructions for making the recipe.
instructions.example:
1. Preheat the oven to 375F.
2. Bread the chicken breasts and brown them on both sides.
3. Top the chicken with marinara sauce and mozzarella cheese.
4. Bake in the preheated oven until the cheese is melted and bubbly.

description.example: This classic Italian dish features breaded chicken topped with marinara sauce and mozzarella cheese.

time.description: Total time required to make the recipe.

youtube.description: URL of a video demonstrating how to make the recipe.

message.description: Message confirming the recipe was created successfully.

code.description: HTTP status code of the response.

recipe.description: Details of the newly created recipe.

area.description: Geographic area where the recipe originated.

get.description: Retrieve the list of all available ingredients

message.description: A message indicating the success of the operation.

code.description: A status code indicating the success of the operation.

thb.description: URL of the thumbnail image for the chicken.

example.desc: The chicken is a type of domesticated fowl, a subspecies of the red junglefowl (Gallus gallus). It is one of the most common and widespread domestic animals, with a total population of more than 19 billion as of 2011. There are more chickens in the world than any other bird or domesticated fowl. Humans keep chickens primarily as a source of food (consuming both their meat and eggs) and, less commonly, as pets. Originally raised for cockfighting or for special ceremonies, chickens were not kept for food until the Hellenistic period (4th2nd centuries BC).

_id.description: The unique identifier for the ingredient list item

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the shopping list was last updated

__v.description: The version number of the shopping list object

data.description: The data returned by the operation
